Abstract: An investigation was made of the dynamics of ultrasonic vibrodrills with a common source of rotational and ultrasonic reciprocal motions. The source was constructed on the basis of an electroacoustic transducer of longitudinal vibrations. The dependences of power, rotation speed, and flutter rates were plotted for various pushers as a function of biological tissue drag torque. The results obtained allowed us to determine the optimal parameters of basic ultrasonic modes used in treating biological tissues. Apart from that, ultrasonic vibrodrill pilot models, which are new in principle, are presented. They were designed to be applied in traumatology. A distinguishing feature of these vibrodrills is that an electroacoustic transducer of longitudinal vibrations is a source of two motion types: rotational and ultrasonic reciprocal.

Abstract: Parkinson's disease involves the loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substantia nigra, leading to movement disorders. The pathological hallmark of Parkinson's disease is the presence of Lewy bodies and Lewy neurites, which are intracellular inclusions consisting primarily of α-synuclein. Although essentially all cases of sporadic and early-onset Parkinson's disease are of unknown etiology, two point mutations (A53T and A30P) in the α-synuclein gene have been identified in familial early-onset Parkinson's disease. Previous reports have shown that mutant α-synuclein may form fibrils more rapidly than wildtype protein. To determine the underlying molecular basis for the enhanced fibrillation of the mutants, the structural properties, responses to changes in the environment, and propensity to aggregate of wildtype, A30P, and A53T α-synucleins were systematically investigated. A variety of biophysical methods, including far-UV circular dichroism, FTIR, small-angle X-ray scattering, and light scattering, were employed. Neither the natively unfolded nor the partially folded intermediate conformations are affected by the familial Parkinson's disease point mutations. However, both mutants underwent self-association more readily than the wild type (i.e., at much lower protein concentration and more rapidly). We attribute this effect to the increased propensity of their partially folded intermediates to aggregate, rather than to any changes in the monomeric natively unfolded species. This increased propensity of these mutants to aggregate, relative to wild-type α-synuclein, would account for the correlation of these mutations with Parkinson's disease.

Abstract: A model of dielectrical properties of cellular structures of a tissue has been proposed. Cellular structures were presented as a composition of membrane covered spheres and cylinders that do not interact with each other. No restrictions were applied to the thickness of cellular membranes. The model was further generalized into a case of electrically interacting cells. The difference in dielectrical properties calculated with the model of electrically noninteracting versus interacting cells is inversely dependent on frequency. At biological values of cellular volume fraction near 0.7 (packed configuration) the difference is about 10%-15% in resistance and in ε' for frequencies near 0.1 MHz. Experimental data for myocardial tissue and theoretical data, for both interacting and noninteracting models, reasonably agree at frequencies of 1-100 MHz. © 2001 Biomedical Engineering Society.

Source title: IEEE Transactions on Ultrasonics, Ferroelectrics, and Frequency Control
Affiliations: IEEE, United States; Institute for Precision and Biomedical Engineering, Warsaw University of Technology, 02-525 Warsaw, Poland; Biomedical Engineering Department, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, MI 48109-2125, United States; Institute of Mathematical Problems of Biology, Russian Academy of Sciences, Pushchino, Moscow Region, 142292, Russian Federation
Abstract: Strain rate images (SRI) of the beating heart have been proposed to identify non-contracting regions of myocardium. Initial attempts used spatial derivatives of tissue velocity (Doppler) signals. Here, an alternate method is proposed based on two-dimensional phase-sensitive speckle tracking applied to very high frame rate, real-time images. This processing can produce high resolution maps of the time derivative of the strain magnitude (i.e., square root of the strain intensity). Such images complement traditional tissue velocity images (TVI), providing a more complete description of cardiac mechanics. To test the proposed approach, SRI were both simulated and measured on a thick-walled, cylindrical, tissue-equivalent phantom modeling cardiac deformations. Real-time ultrasound images were captured during periodic phantom deformation, where the period was matched to the data capture rate of a commercial scanner mimicking high frame rate imaging of the heart. Simulation results show that SRI with spatial resolution between 1 and 2 mm are possible with an array system operating at 5 MHz. Moreover, these images are virtually free of angle-dependent artifacts present in TVI and simple strain rate maps derived from these images. Measured results clearly show that phantom regions of low deformation, which are difficult to identify on tissue velocity-derived SRI, are readily apparent with SRI generated from two-dimensional phase-sensitive speckle tracking.

Abstract: The concept of refractive index matching used for the enhancement of optical penetration depth of the whole blood is discussed on the basis of in vitro studies using optical coherence tomography technique. It was found that blood optical clearing is defined not only by refractive index matching effect, but also by changes of RBC size and their aggregation ability when chemicals are added. Chemical agents studied include glycerol, propylene glycol, trazograph, and dextrans. For the hyperosmotic agents, the application of 6.5% glycerol into twice diluted blood reduces the total attenuation coefficient from 4.2/mm to 2.0/mm, and correspondingly increases the optical penetration at 820 nm up to 117%. Similar effects of increase in transmittance and decrease in light scattering are also demonstrated by various molecular detrans with the light penetration enhancement within a range between 52.1% and 150.5%. We also demonstrate that the use of biocompatible agents could enhance in-depth imaging of the human esophagus and stomach tissues.
Index Keywords: Biomedical engineering; Coherent light; Diagnostic products; Light scattering; Opacity; Refractive index; Tissue; Tomography; Immersion technique; Medical imaging

Abstract: We present experimental results and computer modeling on the optical properties of the human scleral tissue. The wavelength dependence of the refractive index of collagen fibers in the human scleral tissue was estimated on the base of Mie theory. Dispersion formula describing this dependence was derived. The results are general and can be used to describe optical properties of many other fibrous tissues.

Abstract: We have prepared poly(lactide) scaffolds for tissue engineering using supercritical fluid processing in particular using supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO2) technology. scCO2 plasticises the polymer, bringing its glass transition temperature down from 55 degrees Celsius to 25 degrees Celsius. The corresponding reduction in polymer viscosity enables us to mix in thermally- and organic solvent sensitive biological substrates such as growth factors without having a detrimental effect on their activity. Depressurisation yields porous scaffolds free from solvent residues. The scaffolds so produced have been characterised in terms of their porosity by mercury porosimetry and scanning electron microscopy. Furthermore, the degradation behaviour and release properties of these materials have been studied. We have demonstrated that the activity of the enzyme ribonuclease is unaffected by our processing.
Index Keywords: Biopolymers; Enzymes; Glass transition; Growth kinetics; Organic solvents; Plasticizers; Scanning electron microscopy; Substrates; Thermal effects; Tissue culture; Viscoplasticity; Fluid processing; Growth factors; Polymer scaffolds; Tissue engineering; Supercritical fluids

Abstract: A number of contact luminescence photometers and spectrophotometers were worked out at SOI for estimation of functional state of living tissues and organs, and the pathological condition of organism in particular. Contact double-wavelength microfluorometers were designed for fluorescence measurements of pyridine nucleotides and flavoproteids. There are two design modifications of the microfluorometers for biopsy diagnostics and for use during the time an operation. Intraoperation luminescence probe makes it possible to evaluate the status of the blood microcirculation in an organ as basic induce of the vitality of tissues and organs during surgical operations. Processing of this instrument is based on luminescence angiography. A fiber-optic medical spectrophotometer is for fluorescence spectra registration of skin local sections in the region 400-800 nm. Some examples of the clinical use of these apparatus are described.

Abstract: Theoretical investigations of laser light radiation scattered by eye lens model as a system of spheres with various parameters were performed on the base of Mie theory of electromagnetic scattering by a single sphere. The calculations were performed for systems of particles whose coordinates were specifically realized in random fashion according to the specified probabilities defined by the approximation of hard spheres. The modeling of lens biotissue was carried out by using of medical data about internal structure of lens of human and some animals. In general the researchable model presents the system of homogeneous spherical particles those are randomly distributed in the layer of thickness. We study the optical properties such as scattering effective cross-section and function of correlation in different models.

Abstract: An elasticity microscope provides high resolution images of tissue elasticity. With this instrument, it may be possible to monitor cell growth and tissue development in tissue engineering. To test this hypothesis, elasticity micrographs were obtained in two model systems commonly used for tissue engineering. In the first, strain images of a tissue-engineered smooth muscle sample clearly identified a several hundred micron thick cell layer from its supporting matrix. Because a one-dimensional mechanical model was appropriate for this system, strain images alone were sufficient to image the elastic properties. In contrast, a second system was investigated in which a simple one-dimensional mechanical model was inadequate. Uncultured collagen microspheres embedded in an otherwise homogeneous gel were imaged with the elasticity microscope. Strain images alone did not clearly depict the elastic properties of the hard spherical cell carriers. However, reconstructed elasticity images could differentiate the hard inclusion from the background gel. These results strongly suggest that the elasticity microscope may be a valuable tool for tissue engineering and other applications requiring the elastic properties of soft tissue at high spatial resolution (75 μm or less).
Index Keywords: Acoustic microscopes; Image reconstruction; Mathematical models; Strain; Tissue culture; Elasticity microscopes; Tissue engineering; Ultrasonic imaging

Abstract: At the problematic lab of the Seversk Technological Institute of Tomsk Polytechnic University (STI TPU) two devices are used for heavy metals testing in biological objects: an analyzer (TA-1) which uses the method of inverse voltammetry (IV), and a spectrometer (Spectroskan) which uses the method of X-ray-fluorescence analysis (XFA). Professor N.A. Rolpakova (TPU, Chemical Engineering Faculty) uses the technique of platinum (Pt) test in biological materials (blood, urine, tissue) of patients having Pt treatment by an IV method was developed. Pt is used for treatment of oncological diseases. Its molecules bind the cells of a cancerous growth. To know the concentration of this drug in the blood of an oncological patient is necessary for overseeing a course of treatment. The essence of the method is the following: the Pt from assay is transferred to solution. The solution is placed in glass for polarographic measurement. The electrodes are inserted: an operating electrode (impregnated graphite electrode) and a comparison electrode (AgCl). During a definite time (the time of electrolysis) the Pt concentrates on the surface of an electrode together with mercury, which is beforehand entered in a parsed solution (metal-activator). The current of oxidation of the metal-activator, deposited together with Pt, is proportional to the content of Pt in the parsed assay. The content of Pt is determined by a method of standard components. © 2000 IEEE.

Abstract: At the Research institute of Oncology of the Tomsk Science Center of RAMS SD implants from porous titanium nickelide have been applied since 1991. Porous titanium nickelide is a qualitatively new implant material being a successful example of the fusion of physical metallurgy, physics and medicine. Implants using titanium nickelide are well borne by tissues. They have high biological inertness and are nontoxic. With the formation of a strong joint in the contact zone of the recipient implant and bone the bone tissue grows successfully into the porous frame of the implant (V. E. Gyunter, 1998). Patients with malignant neoplasms of the upper jaw have combined treatment as the course of radical therapy is carried out. The second stage is surgical treatment: an electric resection of the upper jaw with simultaneous endoprosthesis provision using an implant of porous titanium nickelide. Taking into account the previously executed anthropometry and the data from radiography and computed tomography of the skull, prosthetic devices are produced of the necessary configuration. When obtaining a personal volumetric model the developed system of design based on computer reconstruction of a bone defect according to the data of X-ray computer tomography is used. In total 114 patients with malignant neoplasms of the upper jaw were operated on with application of endoprosthetic devices of porous titanium nickelide. © 2000 IEEE.

Abstract: Expression of the internal structures of the body of a person may be obtained by means of X-ray devices. The method has so far had no alternatives in surgical practice in terms of being efficient, of width of envelopment of the operating field, of validity and for displaying the objects in real-time. X-ray techniques however have an inherent number of defects: in the image of the investigated object information from accompanying body tissues interferes; the X-ray image in principle does not obtain information on the depth of the displayed structures (it's flat). © 2000 IEEE.

Abstract: In this study, the changes of canine myocardial dielectrical properties in the microwave spectrum caused by acute ischemia and chronic infarction were measured. By using microwave dielectrical spectroscopy data in microwave spectrum, the method of biophysical reconstruction allowed to determine the myocardial resistance and water content. The reconstructed changes of the myocardial resistance and water content dynamically correlated with the process of the development of the myocardial ischemic injury.

Abstract: The concept of biological medium includes such substances as biological tissues and different organs of the person. The paper consider electrical and physical parameters of biological medium under electromagnetic fields of different intensities and frequencies. Under the influence of an external electromagnetic field on a biological medium, secondary currents and charges occur, their value depending both on electrical and physical parameters of this medium, and on intensity and frequency of an exciting field. To analyze the interaction of an exciting electromagnetic field with biological medium, a computer mathematical model is used. The interaction of an inductive converter with the biological medium is considered. © 2000 IEEE.

Abstract: We demonstrate that optical coherence tomography (OCT) is a convenient diagnostic tool to monitor pulse-to-pulse kinetics in laser interactions with biological tissue. In experiments on laser modification and ablation of the cataractous human lens and the porcine cornea we have applied this technique in situ to investigate different modes of preablation tissue swelling, crater formation and thermally affected zone development. The cataractous lens is an example of highly scattering media whereas the cornea is initially low scattering. The radiation with different wavelengths has been employed including that of a YAG:Er laser (λ = 2.94 μm), a glass:Er laser (λ = 1.54 μm), YAG:Nd lasers (λ = 1.32 μm and λ = 1.44 μm), as well as of the fifth harmonic of a Nd:YAP laser (λ = 0.216 μm). Pulse-to-pulse OCT monitoring has been accompanied by the probe beam shielding diagnostics to provide the time-resolved observation of the interaction dynamics. © 1999 Society of Photo-Optical Instrumentation Engineers.

Abstract: Decorrelation and depolarization properties of multiply scattering media and tissues in the case of propagation of coherent probe beams are analyzed in terms of photon path distribution. A specific correlation time determining the relationship between correlation and polarization states of scattered optical fields is introduced. Abstract: In the paper, the sensational biochemical results obtained by two American research groups and published in the October issue of 'Nature' are discussed. The authors succeeded in knocking out the myoglobin expressing gene in mice, and no myoglobin was detected by polyclonal antibodies in ventricular myocytes or in skeletal myofibrils of the knocked-out animals. It is shown that the behavior of the mice was unchanged according to the standard physiological tests. In the author opinion, this 'negative' result is highly significant because it clearly demands reevaluation of a dogma.

Abstract: Chromatographic discs were investigated for their potential to substitute for the hitherto used cartridges in heterogeneous flow injection analysis. Originally designed for fast high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) of biopolymers, the discs combine reliability with speed and resolution. This together with their price and their long-standing time made them attractive for use in flow injection analysis. The base material of the discs is a glycidyl methacrylate-co-ethylene dimethacrylate (GMA-EDMA) co-polymer. The epoxy groups inherent to this base structure can be used for immobilization purposes. In this first demonstration, antibodies were immobilized and the resulting affinity discs used for the fast analysis (<5 min) of protein G from cell lysate of recombinant Escherichia coli. A linear calibration curve over several orders of magnitude as well as excellent reproducibility and correlation with data produced by conventional protein assay were obtained. Abstract: Activation of T cells requires both TCR-specific ligation by direct contact with peptide Ag-MHC complexes and coligation of the B7 family of ligands through CD28/CTLA-4 on the T cell surface. We recently reported that coadministration of CD86 cDNA along with DNA encoding HIV-1 Ags i.m. dramatically increased Ag-specific CTL responses. We investigated whether the bone marrow-derived professional APCs or muscle cells were responsible for the enhancement of CTL responses following CD86 coadministration. Accordingly, we analyzed CTL induction in bone marrow chimeras. These chimeras are capable of generating functional viral-specific CTLs against vaccinia virus and therefore represent a useful model system to study APC/T cell function in vivo. In vaccinated chimeras, we observed that only CD86 + Ag + MHC class I results in 1) detectable CTLs following in vitro restimulation, 2) detectable direct CTLs, 3) enhanced IFN-γ production in an Ag-specific manner, and 4) dramatic tissue invasion of T cells. These results support that CD86 plays a central role in CTL induction in vivo, enabling non-bone marrow-derived cells to prime CTLs, a property previously associated solely with bone marrow-derived APCs.

Abstract: The possibility of the fluorescence spectroscopy for diagnosing a pathology in human tissues is studied now very intensively. However, there are not much and good theoretical models to calculate the fluorescence intensity in scattering and absorbing non-homogeneous biological tissues. Moreover, such models are needed for up-to-date laser medical non-invasive diagnostic equipment and technique which run by principle of an inverse optical task solution. In order to obtain the acceptable model we used the Transport equation and multi-layered plane medium. The Method of Moments was used to solve the Transport equation with calculation of the moment of fluorescence flux at the last step of the solution.
Index Keywords: Computational methods; Emission spectroscopy; Fluorescence; Mathematical models; Method of moments; Tissue; Pathology; Transport equation; Biomedical engineering

Affiliations: Inst of Experimental Endocrinology, of Russian Acad of Medical Sciences, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: This review summarizes data on two hormones, growth hormone (GH) and insulin-like growth factor I (IGF-I). Genes encoding these hormones are actively expressed in various tissues which can synthesize and secrete the corresponding hormones into the intracellular space and blood. Apart from the pituitary, GH gene is also expressed in mammary gland, thymus, spleen, lymph nodes, and blood cells. GH activates expression of the gene of IGF-I and stimulates its secretion by the liver, adipose tissue, thymus, and other tissues. The growth-stimulating effect of GH is mediated (at least partially) by IGF-I, but direct (IGF-I-independent) influence on target tissues is also possible. Genes encoding GH and IGF-I receptors are expressed in all organs and tissues, including various cells of the immune system. GH and IGF-I regulate the function of the immune system via endocrine, paracrine, and autocrine mechanisms.
Index Keywords: Blood; Genes; Genetic engineering; Insulin; Tissue; Gene encoding; Gene expression; Growth hormones; Hormones

Affiliations: Nizhny Novgorod Medical Acad, Nizhny Novgorod, Russian Federation
Abstract: Our investigations have been devoted to OCT capabilities in imaging normal and diseased tooth structures and different types of oral mucosa. OCT tomograms distinctly exhibit the structural elements of oral mucosa. Depending on localization and keratinization, different types of mucosa are also seen in OCT images. OCT images of those parts where epithelium evidences high keratinization substantially differ from images of those parts where epithelium evidences low or no keratinization in its normal state. OCT imaging allows one to clearly differentiate between caries and noncaries lesions, which is very important in practical dentistry. OCT has made it possible to quite accurately diagnose a fissure caries in the early stage that has been unreliable with an X-ray examination. The OCT technique is capable of dynamic monitoring the restorative process. It also allows in vivo examination of fillings as well as the state of surrounding tissues. It is possible to detect filling defects caused by an incorrect filling procedure either during the process of restoration or some time later. The results of our investigations suggest that OCT is a potentially useful modality for clinical and research dentistry.
Index Keywords: Dental prostheses; Dentistry; Medical imaging; Tissue; Tomography; Optical coherence tomography (OCT); Biomedical engineering

Source title: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
Affiliations: General Physics Inst, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: It is well known that sulphophthalocyanine derivatives under laser irradiation induce photochemical reaction of II type with generation of cytotoxic agent - singlet oxygen. The combination of phthalocyanine and exogenic reductant - sodium ascorbate may also induce other reactions, involving the formation of free radicals, and thus intensify the antitumour effect. To improve the results of PDT we used the additional injection of sodium ascorbate, the hyperbaric oxygenation and different regimes of laser irradiation. We conducted the experimental study on 100 white mice with Erlich carcinoma. Macroscopic and microscopic data showed that sodium ascorbate significantly increases the effect of PDT in comparison with control group due to the higher tumour damage, vascular alterations, inhibition of cell proliferation and stimulation of antitumour desmoplastic reaction.
Index Keywords: Aluminum compounds; Laser tissue interaction; Living systems studies; Oncology; Photodynamic therapy; Sodium compounds; Aluminum sulfophthalocyanine; Apoptosis; Hyperbaric oxygenation; Sodium ascorbate; Biomedical engineering

Source title: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
Affiliations: Russian Acad of Sciences, Novosibirsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: The using of KrCl (223 nm) excimer laser in ophthalmic devices for Photorefractive Keratectomy (PRK) and Phototerapeutic Keratectomy (PTK) is offered. The structure and functions of a new surgical UV ophthalmic laser systems Medilex using ArF (193 nm) or KrCl (223 nm) excimer laser for corneal surgery are presented. The systems Medilex with the new optical delivery system is used for photoablative reprofilling of the cornea to correct refraction errors (myopia, hyperopia and astigmatism) and to treat a corneal pathologies. The use of the 223 nanometer laser is proposed to have advantages over the 193 nanometer laser. The results of application of the ophthalmic excimer laser systems Medilex for treatment of myopia are presented.
Index Keywords: Excimer lasers; Laser optics; Laser surgery; Laser tissue interaction; Light refraction; Ophthalmology; Photodynamic therapy; Ultraviolet devices; Astigmatism; Hyperopia; Myopia; Photorefractive keratectomy; Phototherapeutic keratectomy; Biomedical engineering

Source title: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
Affiliations: Medical Univ, Saratov, Russian Federation
Abstract: In experiments on 153 non-inbred white female mice lung tumors were induced by subcutaneous injection of urethan (0.5 mg/g) once a week (4 injections as a whole). Mice of the first group were given urethan only. Animals of the second group underwent transcutaneous He-Ne laser irradiation immediately before each urethan injection. Mice of the third group underwent laser irradiation after cessation of 4-week course of urethan. In 2 months after beginning of the experiments, lungs were investigated by light microscopy. It was stated that in animals of the 1st group lung adenomas appeared in 59% of cases. Average amount of tumors per mouse comprised 1.17. In the 2nd group lung tumors were in 82% of animals (p<0.05). Average amount of tumors per mouse was 1.68. In 2 cases small-cellular lymphocyte-like lung cancer with multicentric growth appeared. Hyperplasia of lymphoid tissue was less in mice with growing tumors. In the animals of the 3d group lung adenomas appeared in 59% of cases. Average amount of tumors per mouse comprised 1.2. It is concluded that He-Ne laser irradiation of animals before injection of chemical carcinogen plays a promoting role in the development of murine lung tumors. Laser irradiation after cessation of carcinogen course has no effect on tumor growth.
Index Keywords: Helium neon lasers; Laser optics; Laser tissue interaction; Living systems studies; Oncology; Optical microscopy; Carcinogenesis; Urethan; Biomedical engineering

Abstract: Combined actions of native and prolonged thrombolytics allow the use of lower doses and simplified schemes of administration, thus yielding significant results in experimental therapy regarding the efficacy and safety of thrombolysis. Development of prolonged forms of plasminogen activators and testing their effect in combination with the thrombolysis trigger are well founded and of current interest. Thrombolytic compositions on the basis of short- and long-term-acting plasminogen activators appear to be promising and potentially eligible for bolus administration.

Abstract: To enhance the efficiency of electrosurgical exposures is a highly topical task. The paper deals with the aspects of enhancing the efficiency by optimizing the basic parameters of electrosurgical equipment and by combining various energy exposures for surgical tissue.

Abstract: Far-zone speckle patterns formation in the case of non-single scattering of the focused coherent probe beams by tissue samples is experimentally studied. Reversible transition between different scattering regimes stimulated by the application of the certain chemical agents to the human sclera samples had been studied using speckle intensity correlation analysis; corresponding results are presented. Possibilities of the scattering structures imaging using structure function analysis of the far-zone dynamic speckles are shown in in-vitro experiments with samples of the human skin epidermis.

Source title: Proceedings of SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering
Affiliations: Institute of Spectroscopy, Russian Academy of Science, Troitsk, Moscow Region 142092, Russian Federation
Abstract: Fiberoptic evanescent wave Fourier transform infrared (FEW-FTIR) spectroscopy using fiberoptic sensors operated in the attenuated total reflection (ATP,) regime in the middle infrared (IR) region of the spectrum (850-1850 cm-1) has recently found application in the diagnostics of tissues. The method is suitable for noninvasive and rapid (seconds) direct measurements of the spectra of normal and pathological tissues in vitro, ex vivo and in vivo. The aim of our studies is the express testing of various tumor tissues at the early stages of their development. The method is expected to be further developed for endoscopic and biopsy applications. We measured in vivo the skin normal and malignant tissues on surface (directly on patients) in various cases of basaloma, melanoma and nevus. The experiments were performed in the operating room for measurements of skin in the depth (under/in the layers of epidermis), human breast, stomach, lung, kidney tissues. The breast and skin tissues at different stages of tumor or cancer were distinguished very clearly in spectra of amide, side cyclic and noncyclic hydrogen bonded fragments of amino acid residuals, phosphate groups and sugars. Computer monitoring is being developed for diagnostics.
Author Keywords: Cancer diagnostics; Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy; Optical fibers; Tissues

Abstract: Time-dependent transmittance spectra of bovine sclera were investigated to understand the mechanism of human sclera optical enlightening due to administration of osmolytes. It was shown that fibrous tissue as sclera can be optically enlighted up to 90% during 10 min of 80% polyethylene glycol (PEG) solution administration at 40°C. The results showed that in experiments tissue temperature, average refractive index, thickness and weight should be monitored concurrently with optical enlightening.

Different regimes of laser ablation and preablation surface transformations are monitored in situ. ©2004 Copyright SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering.

Abstract: Magnitudes of acceleration harmonics and force applied to the biological tissue by an oscillating indenter were measured using techniques developed earlier. The levels of the second and third harmonics of tissue acceleration were found to exceed the respective levels of the indenter.

Abstract: The description of special features of laser light interaction with biotissues, such as the skin, eye and dental tissues etc., with respect to laser diagnostics and therapy methods development is done. The role of static and dynamic light scattering in the light dosimetry, tissue heating, and receiving information of biotissue optical parameters, its structure, movements, and vibrations is considered.

Abstract: Parallel determination of amounts of metallothionein (MT) in bone marrow and liver of the rats in different periods after administrations of cadmium chloride was carried out. The survival rate of gamma irradiation mice at different times after administration of Cd2+ (0.75 mg/kg) was shown to be sharply correlated with the amount of MT induced by this heavy metal in the bone marrow. The connection between the amount of metallothioneins in the liver and the survival rate was less pronounced. It should be particularly emphasized that on degree of radioprotective effect conditioned by MT one could say only after administration of MT cleaned from high-toxic heavy metals.

Abstract: From the analysis of the literature it is inferred that there is one more type of nonspecific protection which is based on the polyploidy process and functions at the cell population and tissue levels. With high radiation loads, this process maintains the functioning rate of the given tissue and the survival rate of the given cell type. A hypothesis is proposed that cell fusion and formation of somatic hybrids, that provide clone survival, are particularly effective in tumour tissues. This mechanism is activated at high radiation doses: fusion of injured cells and formation of polykaryones and then hybrids can give rise to cells capable of reproduction. The cellularity is restored.

Abstract: S phase cell fraction (SPF) was estimated in intact tumours of 82 patients with endometrial and in 47 patients with cervical carcinoma by the indirect immunofluorescence method with antithymidine antibodies. No correlation was found between the SPF and conventional prognostic factors, such as the disease stage or patient's age. The proliferative activity of cervical carcinoma was associated with the immediate response to radiotherapy: complete regression in 3-6 months after the treatment was observed in 90% of patients with the SPF of more than 7% and in only 42% of patients with a lower SPF share. The prognosis was good for the patients with rapidly proliferating tumours too.

Abstract: The method of flow cytogluorimetry was used to study some population characteristics of bone marrow cells of control and irradiated rats. The simultaneous recording of cellularity and distribution of myelocaryocytes among the cell cycle phases was shown to give reliable results for determining the extent to which the organism was exposed at early times following irradiation. Time for one analysis was not more than 2-5 min, and the process could be completely automated. Test in use conforms to the requirements made on the methods of biological indication of body irradiation.

Abstract: The results of clinical radionuclide studies with a morphologic verification of the process, carried out in 353 patients were analysed. Polypositional scintigraphy with colloid was carried out in patients with hydropic and fatty dystrophy of the liver, with nonspecific reactive, chronic persistent, active hepatitis, or liver cirrhosis. The modification permits obtaining additional diagnostic information. Colloid accumulation in scintigraphy of the spleen in the anterior position over 1% is an evidence of a morphologically verified liver involvement. Clinical examinations in disputable cases with the changes detected by scintigraphy, particularly in case of colloid accumulation in the spleen, should include liver puncture.

Abstract: A study was made of the formation of cataract in rats at remote times after whole-body and partial X-irradiation. The whole-body irradiation doses were 5 and 10 Gy (two fractions of 5 Gy at a 30-day interval). Partial exposure of the head and neck, as well as irradiation of chest were performed with doses of 5, 10 (two fractions at a 30-day interval) and 15 Gy (three 5 Gy fractions at a 30-day interval). It has been shown that cataract develops not only due to the direct effect of radiation on the eye, but also to indirect effect on the experimental animal body (with irradiation of the abdomen and diabetes development).

Abstract: Results typical for hemodynamics state in different viscera in dogs treated after irradiation on author's developed scheme were given. Substances - blocators of nervous impulse transfer, complexones, detoxicing media, conservative treatment with antibiotics and vitamins, were used for treatment. Dogs were exposed to X-radiation at a dose of 15 Gy; part of them received a complex treatment. The morphological studies of internal organs of control dogs were made before death (on days 4 to 15 after irradiation). The treated dogs were killed 0.5-2 years following irradiation. Hemodynamics normalization was noted in 1.5-2 years in the liver, brain cortex, adrenals, insular tissue of the pancreas, and lymph nodes.

Abstract: Experiments with mice during irradiation with a dose of 8 Gy (LG96) from criterion of 30-day mortality showed that gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), substances increasing its concentration in tissues (progabide and valproate) and synthetic agonists of the both receptor types possessed radioprotective effect of different expressiveness. Baclofen, a GABA-receptor agonist, protects in doses by an order lower than classic aminothiols. Gamma-hydroxibutirate protects mice only in administration in a great time before irradiation. Pyracetame didn't show radioprotective effect.

Abstract: The data of thermography and radionuclide investigations of 60 patients with breast cancer were presented. Thirty of these patients were administered sodium thiosulfate electrophoresis on the postoperative wound, the rest were controls. The postoperative wounds healed sooner and without complications in the patients administered electrophoresis than in those who received no such treatment as evidenced by the data of thermography and scintigraphy. Radionuclide thermographic investigations significantly expand the possibilities of early revealing purulent inflammatory complications in postoperative period in patients with breast cancer.

Abstract: The radioprotective effect of cysteamine has been studied in larva nerve ganglia of the radiosensitive mutant rad(2)201G, mutagen-sensitive mutant mus(2)201G and the control strain of drosophila. Cysteamine was shown to produce a radioprotective effect in somatic cells of mus(2)201G and the control strain of drosophila which was manifested by the decreased incidence of cells with chromosome aberrations and diminished yield of deletions and exchanges. No significant radioprotective effect of cysteamine was observed in somatic cells of rad(2)201G mutant.

Abstract: Some approaches in development of criteria for assessment of results of in vitro studies of tumour markers are considered. Substantiation of tactics for using tumour markers in clinical practice is given. Use of four markers is concluded to be justified in examination of risk group for oncopathologies. For each of markers it is necessary to have curves of criterion power in all range of determined marker concentration.

Abstract: Effect of chronic gamma-irradiation on adenylate cyclase system producing secondary messenger of AMP i.e. regulator of various metabolic processes was assessed. Pulmonary tissue of rats was tested as sufficiently sensitive to revealing delayed aftereffects. Different phase changes were observed in adenylate cyclase (AC) activity of pulmonary tissue plasma membranes under chronic gamma irradiation of rats at a dose rate of 12.9 cGy/day. The observed changes could be interpreted as adaptive to chronic irradiation of low intensity. Comparison of AC basal activity with the data reported earlier on changes in ornithine decarboxylase activity under similar changes which indicated that cAMP-dependent processes were possibly involved in radiation modification of ornithine decarboxylase.

Abstract: Ninety-eight patients with thyroid cancer metastases were treated with radioactive iodine. 97% of patients survived for 5 years, this group including all the patients with pulmonary metastases. New methods of radiotherapy with open radionuclides were developed. Radiosynoviortez is a method of contact radiotherapy with radioactive colloid gold of the involved large and medium-sized joints of patients with rheumatoid arthritis. A good therapeutic effect was achieved in 85% of all the treated patients. Radioactive phosphorus and gold were used in cases with combined involvement of the small and large joints. Good effect was seen in 90% of patients treated with this method.

Abstract: The results were presented of radiometric and morphological studies of the viscera of dogs and sheep who lived 5 to 7 years with the Hertz-IR type gamma-neutron standard radiation sources, implanted in the abdominal cavity. The most coarse dystrophic and sclerotic changes were found in the visceral sites adjacent to the radiation source or near it. It was suggested that spermatogenesis disorders resulting from chronic low-dose irradiation were due to not only the immediate action of ionizing radiation, but to total disorders of the trophicity of irradiated body as well.

Abstract: Statement of the diagnosis of synovial sarcoma in early period on the example of one patient is analysed. It is too difficult to diagnose synovial sarcoma. Comprehensive x-ray ultrasonic examination is the most informative in detection of tumour. Surgical removal of revealed formation has been conducted to the patient. The formation is dense, joined to muscular fibres, is not connected with the joint. Histological investigation of the formation determines dissemination of malignant tumour, presented by round or oval cells. Tumour tissue is divided by thick fibrous layers, is surrounded by fibrous capsule. The following conclusion is given: synovial sarcoma.

Abstract: A total of 143 patients with gastric carcinomas were involved in analysis, 73 of these were administered multiple-modality treatment and 70 surgery alone. Multiple-modality treatment including preoperative radiotherapy in the dynamic dose fractionating regiment proved to be more effective; this was demonstrated by a lower incidence of recurrences and metastases and by higher values of three-year survival of the patients. The advantages of such method of treatment were particularly marked in patients with the disseminated forms of gastric carcinoma (stage 3 of the process, metastases to the regional lymph nodes).
Index Keywords: Biological materials; Biomedical engineering; Data processing; Dosimetry; Gamma rays; Oncology; Radiation effects; Radiotherapy; Tissue; Gastric carcinoma; Patient treatment

Affiliations: MRNTs RAMN, Obninsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Determination of efficacy of independent course of remote radiotherapy was conducted in patients with prostatic carcinoma without metastases. Efficacy assessment was given with account for variants of dose fractionation, local dissemination and differentiation degree of the tumour. Immediate and delayed radiation reactions were analyzed. Three and five-year survival rate was higher in group of patients with local tumour stage as compared with local disseminated stages. Data on the causes of death of patients in time from 2 to 135 mos of observation were presented.
Index Keywords: Biological materials; Biomedical engineering; Data processing; Dosimetry; Gamma rays; Oncology; Patient treatment; Radiation effects; Tissue; Prostatic carcinoma; Radiotherapy

Affiliations: Research Inst. of Military Medicine, Ministry of Defence of Russian Fed., St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: Effect of synthetic analogue of natural peptide regulators (analogue of leu-enkephaline) - dalargin hexapeptide on repair processes of in case of combined radiation effects was studied. Following gamma irradiation the skin-muscle injury in the back of 10% area of the whole body was inflicted to the mice under ester narcosis. Dalargin injected over a period of 10 days was shown to exert a stimulating effect on proliferative and biosynthetic processes in the skin and muscle wound of the irradiated mice. Dalargin application in combined radiation injuries was shown to promote decrease of tissue edema manifestation, acceleration of epithelization rates and healing of wounds.

Affiliations: Tsentral'nyj NII Stomatologii VNPO, 'Stomatologiya', Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: Only two roentgenography methods (periapical and occlusion) are used for production of dental roentgenograms. Periapical survey must be used only for revealing state of bone tissue around tooth root tops. In parodontology it is necessary to use occlusion survey. Perfection of the methods and improvement of quality of tooth roentgenograms demand to change the design of native dental x-ray unit: elongation of its tube, increase of radiator power. Introduction of orthopantomography as basis method of roentgenography in stomatology is the most radical decision of methodological problems. Orthopantomography is replaced by intra- and extra-oral roentgenography of teeth and jaws.
Index Keywords: Biological materials; Biomedical engineering; Data processing; Diagnosis; Image analysis; Imaging techniques; Medical imaging; Patient monitoring; Tissue; X ray apparatus; Stomatology; Diagnostic radiography

Affiliations: Inst Biofiziki MZ RF, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: A comparison was made of the biological effect on mice of irradiation at different dose rates (70, 5,5 and 1.5 cGy/min) with equally effective, with respect to lethality, doses, or with physically equal doses within the range from 1/4 of LD50/30 to LD95/30. Equally effective, with respect to lethality, doses caused similar changes in the intestinal epithelium and in the haemopoietic system. The death rate kinetics was identical with doses of LD95/30 within the dose-rate range under study. The equally effective doses caused injuries, different in degrees, to critical systems, including CFUs.

Abstract: Program for complex use of x-ray and ultrasonic diagnostic methods, x-ray computerized tomography was worked out in diseases of the abdominal organs, retroperitoneal space. Creation of such program was necessary due to acute surgical intervention in disease of these organs (1750 patients with clinical picture of acute diseases of abdomen cavity organs). Obtaining of momentary information for diagnosis is required in most of cases. Schemes are suggested for complex usage of these diagnostic methods in different pathology, clinical symptoms, severity in patient state, technical possibilities of medical establishments.

Abstract: Comparison of routine examination methods with computerized tomography (CT) was conducted for study on roentgenologic features of silicosis and silicotuberculosis. 55 patients at the age of 35-65 and with length of service in 10 years and more were examined. It was established that CT permitted to refine the nature of changes in pulmonary tissue (emphysema, foci, cavities of decomposition) to determine the sizes of lymph nodes in roots of lungs and mediastinum. The size of dissemination in pulmonary tissue are defined more clearly at CT, that helps to differentiate nodules from foci.

Abstract: Injection of prodigiosane to mice 24 h before irradiation caused, by the time of the radiation effect, a decrease in the number of haemopoietic cells-precursors (CFUs and CFU-HM) in the bone marrow and an increase in the functional activity of stromal cell-precursors - the haemopoietic microenvironmental of transfer units (HMTU); in the spleen, the number of CFUs decreased, but the number of CFU-HM increased considerably. During the postirradiation period, the hamopoietic and stromal precursors were damaged to a lesser extent, and CFUs, CFU-HM and HMTU recovered more readily in prodigiosane-protected animals than in nonprotected mice; the HMTU restoration preceded the increase in CFUs and CFU-HM levels.

Abstract: A study was made of role and place of ionizing radiation in radio- and combined treatment of generalized forms of laryngeal papillomatosis. Results of treatment of 74 patients for 3 years were analysis. It was revealed that combined treatment of both generalized and malegnancy laryngeal papillomatosis using preoperative irradiation and subsequent operation was the effective and the most expedient method. Radiotherapy as independent method permitting to save functional organ, is used in presence of contraindications to conducting surgical intervention.

Abstract: Data on the effect of gamma radiation on phospholipid content of membranes of liver mitochondria of the fetus and maternal organism at various stages of pregnancy were presented. A single exposure of pregnant rats to 1 and 2 Gy radiation on days 3, 13 and 17 of reception changed the phospholipid content in membranes of liver mitochondria of fetus and maternal organism. The changes were particularly pronounced on day 3 of reception: as the embryo grew the decline in the phospholipid content from the control level decreased. The deviation of phospholipid content of mitochondria membrane from the control level following gamma-radiation appeared to be one of the main reasons of high radiosensitivity of the fetus and maternal organism at initial stages of pregnancy.

Abstract: A mathematical model was developed to describe the dynamics of the crypt-villus system of the small intestine epithelium in nonirradiated and chronically irradiated mammals. The model involved the chalone mechanism of regulation of crypt cell reproduction and represented a system of nonlinear differentiation equations. The model presented the dynamics of the small intestine epithelium in nonirradiated animals, including stable fluctuations of the concentrations of crypt and villus cells (the limited cycle), and simulated quantitatively the impairment of the intestinal epithelium in small laboratory animals subjected to long-term irradiation.

Abstract: In experiments with mice and dogs irradiated with LD50, it was shown the postirradiation depopulation of haemopoietic polypotent (CFUs) cells-precursors in mouse bone marrow was more pronounced than that of granulocytic and macrophagal cells (CFUdc). The rate of repopulation of CFUs during the first week was higher that of CFUdc (T1÷2 was 2.5 and 8.8 days respectively). In dogs, one could notice a partial change in the colony formation, a prolonged plateau period in the postirradiation CFUdc dynamics, and a coincidence in time with cellularity restoration in the bone marrow and peripheral blood leukocytes. It was suggested that in conditions of heterogeneous incubation in diffuse chambers, the haemopoietic cells-precursors were more mature than in the syngeneic system.

Abstract: As early as 5-7 min after the start of exposure of tissue preparations from rat trachea ciliated epithelium to gamma-irradiation at a dose rate of 19 mGy/h, the ciliary motion rate increased periodically. The phenomenon of increasing the ciliary motion occurred more frequently in time; the intervals between two frequency drops became longer and the mean frequency level higher. The reverse sequence of the events was observed during the postirradiation period. The same regularities, but less expressed, were observed after irradiation at a dose rate of 1.8 mGy/h.

Abstract: The authors analyze the results of follow-up of 269 patients after radical surgery and discuss the possibility of individualized planning of multiple-modality treatment of resectable forms of rectal carcinoma. They claim that bearing in mind the effects of certain factors on the patients' survival, it is possible to single out a complex of signs influencing the disease outcome. Multifactorial mathematical analysis of these signs helps make up the decisive rule, that permits the choice of the most effective preoperative radiation exposure of the tumour as part of multiple-modality treatment; the reliability of this choice is over 75%.

Abstract: A comparative study was made on the survival rate of cell-precursors of haemopoietic stroma, that form, in a rat bone marrow culture, colonies (clones) of fibroblasts (CFU-F) after gamma-irradiation of animal in the air or in a gas hypoxic mixture, containing 8% of O2 (GHM-8). Irradiation in GHM-8 was shown to increase the survival rate of CFU-F by 1.7 times (as compared to exposure in the air) as estimated by the total number of colonies that were formed in a culture; the radioprotective effect of GHM-8 was more pronounced for CFU-F which form dense and loose clones was 24 and 1.6 respectively.

Abstract: Effect of hyperbaric oxygenation (HBO) on oxygen regime of tissues and systemic hemodynamics in miners with vibration pathology was studied (56 miners with verified diagnosis of vibration diseases of I degree). HBO was shown to exert positive effect not only on tissue oxygen balance and on regional blood flow, tolerance to physical loads in patients: with vibration diseases. Further development HBO regime in case of the presented pathology with account to concomitant professional diseases and general somatic pathology was shown to be much promising.

Abstract: A study of made of some embryological, hematological, cytogenic and biochemical characteristics in Wistar rats exposed within the Chernobyl NPP zone over a period of 30 days. The quantity of chromosome aberrations in bone marrow metaphases and the embryonal death rate were invariable; some cases of teratogenesis were, however, observed. The total number of karyocytes in the brain and the leukocyte content in the peripheral blood sometimes decreased. The changes in certain characteristics of the endogenous radioresistance background (ERB) and the normalization of the ERB by the radioprotective agent MIGI-K were found.

Abstract: Angio- and microangiographic methods of investigation were used for evaluation of changes occuring in animal liver vessels after intra-arterial introduction of protein microspheres. Data received permit to give a full evaluation of the dynamics of changes in liver vessels. Changes in liver vessel after selective intra-arterial introduction of native microspheres of human serum albumin carry temporary character. These changes approach norm by 20-th day after the action. Investigation data permit to suggest on possibility in usage of native protein microspheres as radionuclide carriers for endovascular radiotherapy.

Abstract: An attempt was made to reveal dextran-sulphate (DS) effect on a critical system, i.e. jejunal epithelium stem cells which were responsible for recovery of another system of cellular repair - intestinal epithelium following it's radiation injury. Hypoxic gaseous mixture containing 10% of O2 and 90% of N2 (GHM-10) was applied separately and in combination with DS in the experiments in order to reveal possible participation of oxygen effect in the observed changes. Injection of dextran sulphate before irradiation was shown to protect jejunal epithelium stem cells. The protective effect of a combination of DS and GHM-10 did not exceed that of the administration of the GHM-10 alone.

Abstract: Since 1984, 73 patients with stomach cancer were treated with preoperative irradiation and radical operation. An unconventional method of radiotherapy - a dynamic dose fractionation regimen - was developed and employed. A total dose of 25 Gy was delivered to a tumour for 11 days, 2 fractions a day. Any marked acute or chronic toxicities resulting from irradiation were unnoticed. Three patients died within one month after operation. At the time of the present report, 44 patients are still alive; 23 patients died, a median survival time being 25 month. Although the follow-up period was insufficient, the results seem most encouraging.

Abstract: Linear parameters of the thyroid were considered to develop scintifically substantiated method of determining thyroid dimensions. Ultrasound examination of the thyroid was performed in healthy people. Average group indices of linear organ parameters were established. 3800 healthy persons were examined. 3 linear parameters of each lobe of the thyroid were measured: length, thickness and width. Thyroid dimensions were shown to be enlarged at the age 18-20 years, then dimensions were shown to be stable and after age 60 years they tended to decrease. Three types of ultrasound structure depending on lobe thickness and width ratio were distinguished: triangular, flat and cone-shape.

Abstract: The mean and individual values of three parameters, tumour size and blood supply level. as well as duration of the tumour growth delay were compared in mice with Ehrich's carcinomas of various sizes (on days 5, 7 or 9 after intramuscular inoculation) after irradiation and that followed by artificial hyperglycemia and local hyperthermia. Blood supply to the tumours and the antitumour effect of irradiation reduced with the tumour growth. Analysis of individual values of the considered parameters has shown the principal role of tumour blood flow depression in enhancement of the antitumour effect of irradiation by means of postradiation induced hyperglycemia and local hyperthermia, as well as in the relationship between this antitumour effect and the tumour size.

Abstract: The influence of a tumour necrosis factor, administered 16 h before irradiation of rats, on the radiation response of thymus and bone marrow cells has been investigated. Three and 6 h after irradiation the following indices were analyzed: the number of apoptotic cells in the thymus; the accumulation of polydeoxyribonucleotides and the appearance of single-strand breaks in DNA of bone marrow and thymus cells; and the electrophoretic properties of thymocyte DNA. The injection of a tumour necrosis factor reduced the number of polydeoxyribonucleotides, inhibited internucleosome DNA fragmentation, and did not influence the formation of single-strand breaks in DNA.

Abstract: A study was made of therapeutic action of electromagnetic radiation (EMR) of low intensity (millimetric range), expedience of its usage in comprehensive treatment of patients with purulent wound infection. Therapeutic action of EMR is connected with the control of recovery processes and with mobilization of own reserve possibilities of a body 66 patients with injuries to the limbs, complicated by wound infections, were analyzed. External appearance of wounds, time of some phases of wounded process, rate of phases of wounds as compared with dynamics of change in differential blood count were evaluated.

Abstract: Method of invasive β-radiometry in breast cancer was developed. Analysis of observations of 148 patients with breast cancer was presented. All diagnosis were confirmed by results of morphological investigations. Qualitative increase of count efficiency is the important advantage for interstitial β-radiometry in intratumoral situation of β-detectors. Radionuclide activity of 37-74 kBq/kg permits to receive values of relative accumulation of 32P in a tumour (RAPTu1) by invasive method. Tendency is evident to some decrease of mean values of RAPTu1 in investigations conducted in 70 h and more after 32P introduction. Study on relative accumulation of radionuclide in tumour after conservative treatment can serve as a criterion for evaluation of efficiency of antitumoral treatment.

Abstract: Application of extracorporal systems (ECS) for sustaining the lost organ functions and in treatment of critical states is considered. It is shown that the ECS enable extension of the sphere of their application by treatment of acute superlative diseases besides the natural liver tissues and metabolically active spleen tissue and combination in one system of two types of biological tissues - liver and spleen. Mass exchange structural peculiarity, which makes it possible to maintain required level of asepsis, is noted. High efficiency of the system by temporary substitution of liver and spleen functions by critically ill patients is demonstrated.

Abstract: The evaluation of structures determining the aftereffects of skin radiation was carried out. Determination of the structures is important for explanation of mechanisms of its radiation damage; to avoid undesirable skin reaction during radiotherapy of more deep situated organs; for justification of treatment methods of radiation skin injuries; for choice of geometry of sensitive layers of personal emergency skin dosimeter. Aftereffects of acute human skin radiation are observed in absorbed doses more than 20 Gy. Skin serves as a clear example of that fact that form of acute radiation injury is determined by not an organ but tissue.

Abstract: Inhibition of tissue oxygenation of rat liver homogenate by caprone burning products was studied. Potentialities of correcting tissue oxygenation by methaemoglobine solution were studied. Complex of caprone combustion products caused inhibition of tissue separating oxidation and phosphysation processes. Introduction of methaemoglobine solution resulted in normalization of tissue oxygenation and accelerated cytochrome oxidase reactivation. Methaemoglobine displayed antidotal effect influencing pathogenetic intoxication mechanism.

Abstract: One-digital parameters of intensity and time of noise and vibration effect on the man were obtained. The parameters permitted to forecast probability of hearing injuries and vibration disease development. The parameters could be used as biological shift and length of service doses of noise and vibration. From shift biodoses the probability of hearing injury and development of vibration disease could be calculated in case of various duration of operation under the presented conditions. From length of service biodoses length of service for the preset probability of development of hearing injury and vibration disease was calculated.

Abstract: Primary reactions of excitable tissue to the effect of energetic factors of low-intensity electromagnetic and mechanical nature were studied. Isolated pacemaker of frog's heart served as a model of excitable tissue. Millimeter radiowaves of 76.92 GHz frequency (extremely high frequency EHF) and ultrasound radiation of 5.76 PHz (USI) were used as influencing factors. In case of combined effect of EHF and USI of near-threshold intensities with wave length of 1 mm in the excitable tissue nonlinear superadditive type of summation of the induced effect was established.

Abstract: Multichamber toxicokinetic model studies of the resorption, distribution and excretion properties of poorly soluble substances in subchronic action of suspensions administered intragastrically can be the first step in prognosing the toxicokinetic properties of the inhaled aerosols of the substances mostly discharged from the respiratory into the gastrointestinal tract (GIT). Affiliations: Inst Sel'skoj Gigieny, Saratov, Russian Federation
Abstract: Biological effect of mixed fodder dust of concentrations not exceeding MPC on the respiratory organs was studied. The dust concentration was kept at the level of 1 and 6 mg/m3. Chronic inhalation of low concentrations of dust was shown to produce exogenous allergic alveolitis in the experiments on laboratory animals. Fodder dust at the MPC level and below produced considerable changes of immune system in the form of allergic reaction of delayed type. The changes were directly dependent on dust concentration and duration of its effect.
Index Keywords: Air pollution; Biological materials; Biomedical engineering; Blood; Data processing; Dust abatement; Dust control; Hemodynamics; Immunology; Morphology; Tissue; Allergic alveolites; Living systems studies

Affiliations: NII Oncologii i Meditsinskoj, Radiologii Minzdrav Belorussii, Minsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: Acid-base equilibrium (ABE) in blood, pH in tumoral and normal tissues, cure of animals in induced hyperglycemia (IN), local hypoxia (LH), local hypoxia (LH) were studied. Irradiation was conducted with different doses, combination of various actions was used. It was shown that use of IH in combination with LH promoted superadditive drop in pH of blood and Walker's 256 carcinoma. Postradiation use of IH in combination with LH increase efficacy of irradiation more than 3 fold (TID=3.13). In vivo assumption was confirmed on importance of pH decrease and creation of hypoxia in tumour for modification of radiation injury in postradiation period.
Index Keywords: Biological materials; Biomedical engineering; Blood; Cells; Data processing; Living systems studies; Modification; Oncology; Radiation effects; Radiotherapy; Risk assessment; Tissue; Hyperglycemia; Hypoxia; Radiation damage

Affiliations: Gosudarstvennyj Univ, Kiev, Russian Federation
Abstract: The activity of enzymes of the antioxidation system and the content of some lipid peroxidation products in the liver and thymus of irradiated (0.21 C per kg) rats were investigated. Glutathione reductase and glutathione transferase activity in the liver and thymus of rats decreased during the first 24 h after irradiation. There was a phase change in the catalase activity during the initial postirradiation period. The content of malonic dialdehyde increased immediately after irradiation and somewhat decreased during the first 24 h. In 24 h, there observed a radiation-induced increase in the diene conjugate content in the liver and thymus of rats, against the background of low activity of such antioxidation system enzymes as glutathione transferase, glutatione reductase and catalase.

Affiliations: MNIRRI Minzdrav RF, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: Radiation reactions of 110 patients with pulmonary carcinomas, irradiated according to the accelerated dose fractionation method, and of 102 patients exposed to the traditional low-dose fractionation mode are compared. Local radiation responses of the skin and total radiation reactions predominated in the group, administered the traditional treatment, whereas radiation-induced shifts of the esophageal and pulmonary tissue mucosa were more incident and severe in patients exposed to accelerated dose fractionation, but these shifts were negligible and did not prevent the planned therapy to be carried out.

Affiliations: TsOLIUV, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: References to different methods of cobalt detection in biologic material are given. Polarographic detection of cobalt in human urine and animal biologic material worked out by authors was used for evaluation of biologic MAC. Biologic material was limed by nitric and sulphuric acids. Sulphuric acid was carefully distilled off the burnt material. Mineralized material was dissolved in 10 ml of 1N hydrochloric acid, filtered and again steamed into moist salts. The method can be used for detection of cobalt in urine of workers contacting with the stated metal. Sensitivity of the method is 0.02 mkg/ml.

Affiliations: Vsesoyuznyj Nauchnyj Tsentr, Radiatsionnoj Meditsiny AMN SSSR, Kiev, Russian Federation
Abstract: Evaluation of the health status of population exposed to radiation as a result of the Chernobyl accident is a problem of paramount importance. The results of demographic and epidemiologic surveys and clinical observations have shown that changes in the morbidity rates among children and adults at the strictly controlled districts in the Ukraine result not only from improved diagnostic service, but also from the after effects of the Chernobyl accident. A tendency to a growth of primary disease incidence among children and adults was established. Analysis of the results of follow-up of children has revealed an increased incidence of thyroid cancer. The accident caused an unfavorable demographic situation in the Republic.
Index Keywords: Biological Materials - Tissue; Biomedical Engineering - Oncology; Human Engineering - Health Hazards; Nuclear Reactors - Core Disruptive Accident; Risk Studies - Public Risks; Chernobyl Accident; Risk Studies

Affiliations: NII Meditsinskoj Radiologii AMN SSSR, Obninsk, Russian Federation
Abstract: A study was made cancer morbidity (1989) of the population of the Chelyabinsk Region and on 5 territories, exposed to radioactive contamination. As compared to the whole of Russia, total cancer morbidity rates for Chelyabinsk are significantly high, including those of rectal, lung and skin cancer both in men and women. The rates of breast cancer and hemoblastosis morbidity in women were also high. Total cancer morbidity rates on the study territories were lower than the mean district indices. On the tentative territories lip cancer morbidity both in men and women was higher than the mean district indices; esophageal cancer morbidity rates in women on the same territories was rather high.
Index Keywords: Biological Materials - Tissue; Biomedical Engineering - Oncology; Human Engineering - Health Hazards; Industrial Plants - Sanitation; Risk Studies - Public Risks; Cancer; Morbidity; Risk Studies

Affiliations: MNIRRI MINZDRAV RSFSR, Leningrad, Russian Federation
Abstract: Analysis of morbidity rates of the population in a territory with a high level of 131Cs (over 5 Cl per km2) revealed an increased incidence of nodular goitre and thyroiditis. This analysis covers a 5-year period after the Chernobyl accident. Mass screening by ultrasonic scanning was employed. Higher incidence of psychic disorders and diseases of the hemopoietic organs is explained by a chronic stress developing because of constant restrictions in community behaviour regulations. Dispensary data on a number of population in controlled territories of the Bryansk Region were presented, as population residing in territory of West areas of the Bryansk Region referred to risk group according to development of malignant tumours of thyroid, lungs, mammary gland. Comparative evaluation of morbidity rates over 1990 in Bryansk region as a whole, its West areas and RSFSR was suggested.
Index Keywords: Biological Materials - Blood; Biological Materials - Tissue; Human Engineering - Health Hazards; Nuclear Reactors - Core Disruptive Accident; Risk Studies - Public Risks; Chernobyl Accident; Risk Studies

Affiliations: TsOLIUV, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: Altogether 19 patients with chronic laryngo- and tracheostenosis of different etiology were investigated. All the patients were broken into 3 groups (1 - less than 1 year, 2 - 1-3 years, 3 - over 3 years) with regard to the time of canulla bearing. The patients were examined with 99mTc-human serum albumin particles. Major disorders in the capillary blood supply of both lungs were detected. These changes were focal-diffuse. Abnormalities were mainly observed in the apical area of both lungs and in the mediastinal zone. Redistribution of the pulmonary blood supply in the direction of the upper parts of the lungs was revealed. Lung abnormalities increased depending on the time of canulla bearing.

Abstract: Gamma-beam therapy of cancer patients is accompanied by general and local radiation reactions, their degree depending on numerous factors (a tumor site, an area of irradiated tissues and value of a total absorbed dose). Preventive and therapeutic measures during radiotherapy allow the reduction of severity of a course of general and local radiation reactions.

Abstract: The paper is concerned with physicotechnical and dosimetric support of technology of therapeutic whole-body irradiation on a serial gamma-apparatus Rocus, with which a majority of radiological institutions in the USSR are fit out. Technology consists of the following procedures: patient positioning with relation to a source with a horizontal axis of radiation; correction of dose distribution by means of a three-element compensator taking into account patient's constitutional peculiarities and preradiation preparation data; double irradiation in the bilateral regimen in the supine position.

Affiliations: Sanitarno-Gigienicheskij, Meditsinskij Inst, St. Petersburg, Russian Federation
Abstract: Effect of dust of synthetic detergent (SD) on the status of upper respiratory organs of the workers was studied. 99 workers 20-55 aged were subjected to otolaringological examination. Dust of SD produced mainly catarrh changes of the upper respiratory organs in workers with small experience of work and it affected the functional state of the organs. In workers with prolonged experience of work (from 1 up to 5 years and above) the catarrh phenomena turned into atrophy and that resulted in development of vasomator injuries. Barrier and detoxification functions of ciliated epithelium of nasal cavity was disturbed in workers under the effect of SD dust. The process promoted changes of local blood circulation and penetration of dust particles into the bronchi.
Index Keywords: Air Pollution - Control; Biological Materials - Tissue; Biomedical Engineering - Diagnosis; Industrial Hygiene - Health Hazards; Occupational Diseases - Pulmonary; Medical Surveillance; Personnel

Affiliations: Vsesoyuznyj Nauchnyj Tsentr, Radiatsionnoj Meditsiny AMN SSSR, Kiev, Russian Federation
Abstract: The radioprotective properties of pectin-vitamin powder (PVP) were investigated. PVP was prepared from dry citrus (lemon, orange) peels by special technology. Besides unavailable carbohydrates, it contains pectin (more than 15%), vitamins B, C, P, PP, mineral components. PVP effectively protected from incorporation of radionuclides contained in food products. The blocking effect of PVP was found essentially higher than that of sodium alginate or dry pectins. The optimal daily dose was experimentally defined.
Index Keywords: Biological Materials - Tissue; Biomedical Equipment - Radionuclides; Protective Coatings - Hazards; Radiation Damage - Recovery; Radiation Protection - Medical Applications; Radioprotective Substances; Biomedical Engineering

Abstract: A study was made of the cytological criteria of various degrees of radiation pathomorphosis of soft tissue cancers and sarcomas in different dose fractionation regiments and varying time of a preoperative interval. Combinations of the main and additional parenchymatous and stromal cytological signs, reflecting pathomorphosis of 1-1Y degrees were singled out. Schemes of cytological prediction of a direct effect of tumor radiation exposure were drawn up on the basis of regularities of changes in cellular pictures, obtained from diagnostic data before irradiation.

Abstract: Experiments have shown that percent ratio of sodium iodate and iodide (123I) administered per os produces no marked effect on iodine absorption by the thyroid within the interval of 2-24 hours after its administration.Experiments have shown that percent ratio of sodium iodate and iodide (123) administered per os produces no marked effect on iodine absorption by the thyroid within the interval of 2-24 hours after its administration.It is shown that under peroral administration of iodine into animal organism oxidation-reduction processes in oral cavity, stomach and blood take place, which cause significant changes in initial ratio of administered iodine forms. Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to consider a number of biological and clinicomorphological signs of human tumors which influence the prediction of a course of disease as well as prognosis of a tumor response to radiation exposure. Analysis of the literature has shown that some factors of quite a favourable course of a tumor process are likely to be the signs of clinical radioresistance of the tumor. A strong pssibility of individual prognosis of a tumor response to radiation theraphy was shown for oropharyngeal and stomach tumors even at its onset, guided by change in the level of their proliferative activity, determined with an indirect immunofluorescent rapid method. The probability of detecting tumors, which are clincally radioresistant to proposed therapy, is 82.4-95%.

Abstract: A tumor response to chemoradiotherapy was studied in 260 patients with small-cell lung carcinoma in situ on the basis of clinical parameters using different regiments of dose fractionation and various levels of total focal doses. Nonclassical irradiation regiments were found superior to routine dose fractonation. At present it seems improbable to predict a responce of small-cell lung carcinoma to irradiation and polychemotherapy on the basis of clinical parameters in each individual case. A varied response of small-cell cancer to conservative antitumor therapy is likely to be determined by its morphological, biological and genetic heterogeneity.

Abstract: The paper is concered with analysis of the survival of 385 lung cancer patients with roentgenologically measured nodular tumor type, verified diagnosis. The patients were followed up for 5-6 years. The effect of tumor growth rates on the survival rates was shown to be the result of the use of various therapeutic methods or their absence. The results suggest that by tumor growth rates, assessed before treatment, one can predict, in most cases, a tumor response to one or another therapeutic method. On the basis of these results an adequate method can be chosen for each individual case.

Affiliations: Moskovskij Nauchno-Issledovatel'skij, Onkologicheskij Inst im. P.A., Gertsena, Moscow, Russian Federation
Abstract: In order to determine the prognostic value of a 'subcapsular test' in assessment of individual sensitivity of lung tumors to antitumor action, research was conducted into the histological structure of 18 human lung tumors and 110 grafts of these tumors, which had grown within 6 days under the renal capsule in mice under the immunosuppressed condition, caused by whole-body irradiation. The presence of necrosis in an original tumor led to connective tissue growth in grafts. The stroma per parenchyma ratio in grafts was increased as compared to original tumors. Lymphoid infiltration in 6-day grafts was, as a rule, unmarked. In 2 of 18 cases histotypes of a primary tumor and its grafts differed, i.e. the 'subcapsular test' could be used to detect latent polymorphism of lung tumors. Correct prognosis of an individual response of human lung tumors to antitumor action with the 'subcapsular test' also necessitated histological verification of the results.

Abstract: The authors resorded to multifactor comparative analysis of the results of surgical (218) and combined (413) treatment of patients with thoracic esophageal cancer to study the interrelationship of the main factors, determining a cancer stage, their prognostic value, and a degree of influence of preoperative modalitites on these factors. Preoperative irradiation was shown to increase resectability of the esophagus with tumor extent over 5 cm and to improve the prognosis of disease.

Abstract: A total of 40 patients with bening and malignant paranasal sinusal and nasopharyngeal tumors were examined to evaluate the effectiveness of radiation and surgical treatment with the help of computerized tomography (CT). The aim of CT examinations was to reveal CT-findings of radiation pathomorphosis of a tumor mass and contiguous tissue, to determine their CT-structure, and to find residual masses after the treatment. CT-finding of three stages of tumor radiation pathomorphosis were determined. Besides, sings of a radiation reaction of the paranasal sinusal mucosa and consequences of cerebral radiation necrosis were described. Some criteria of objective assessment of the results of radiation and surgical treatment of paranasal sinusal and nasopharyngeal tumors were proposed.
